description: Half the time, half the carbs, and like... most of the delish. We use mayo to bind the breadcrumbs to just one half of the chicken breast, so you're still getting those tasty, crisp edges with way less effort and way less cleanup. Great for when you want to indulge but not go crazy.

steps.flavor_text: Preheat your {e, oven, 1} to the broiler setting on high. The broiler is the hottest setting of your oven, and it emits heat only from the top down.
steps.text: Preheat your oven to the broiler setting on high. The broiler is the hottest setting of your oven, and it emits heat only from the top down.

steps.flavor_text: Now slice off a few thin rounds of {i, mozzarella, 1}. Pre-shredded is fine as well. The amount of cheese is really up to you. Then fetch your {i, tomato sauce, 2} for later!
steps.text: Now slice off a few thin rounds of mozzarella. Pre-shredded is fine as well. The amount of cheese is really up to you. Then fetch your tomato sauce for later!

steps.flavor_text: Time to butterfly your {i, chicken breast, 1}! This is an exciting step for you. We're essentially going to halve it the same way you would slice through a bagel or English muffin. Place your hand on the top of the breast, and run your knife, parallel to the counter surface, all the way through the chicken, creating two thinner chicken breasts. Normally for a butterfly, you leave a little hinge and not cut all the way through, but we like separating into two smaller portions.
steps.text: Time to butterfly your chicken breast! This is an exciting step for you. We're essentially going to halve it the same way you would slice through a bagel or English muffin. Place your hand on the top of the breast, and run your knife, parallel to the counter surface, all the way through the chicken, creating two thinner chicken breasts. Normally for a butterfly, you leave a little hinge and not cut all the way through, but we like separating into two smaller portions.

steps.flavor_text: Place the two chicken pieces down on a cutting board, cover them with a layer of {e, plastic wrap, 2}, and beat the hell out of them with a {e, rolling pin, 1} or a wine bottle until they are about 1/2 an inch thick. They don't need to be perfect, but the thinner the better.
steps.text: Place the two chicken pieces down on a cutting board, cover them with a layer of plastic wrap, and beat the hell out of them with a rolling pin or a wine bottle until they are about 1/2 an inch thick. They don't need to be perfect, but the thinner the better.

steps.flavor_text: Start heating up a pan--preferably an {e, oven safe pan, 1} like cast iron or stainless steel--with a generous splash of olive oil over medium heat.
steps.text: Start heating up a pan--preferably an oven safe pan like cast iron or stainless steel--with a generous splash of olive oil over medium heat.

steps.flavor_text: Add a 1/2 cup of {i, Italian breadcrumbs, 1} (or seasoned panko) to a plate.
steps.text: Add a 1/2 cup of Italian breadcrumbs (or seasoned panko) to a plate.

steps.flavor_text: Season both sides of the chicken
steps.text: Season both sides of the chicken

steps.flavor_text: Lay the chicken pieces mayo side down into the breadcrumbs and do your best to make sure there is a nice, even layer of breading.
steps.text: Lay the chicken pieces mayo side down into the breadcrumbs and do your best to make sure there is a nice, even layer of breading.

steps.flavor_text: Carefully lay the chicken pieces into the hot oil breaded side down. Cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes. If it starts to burn, flip that guy! Be careful not to accidentally scrape off the breading since it's adhered delicately.
steps.text: Carefully lay the chicken pieces into the hot oil breaded side down. Cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes. If it starts to burn, flip that guy! Be careful not to accidentally scrape off the breading since it's adhered delicately.

steps.flavor_text: Cook on the second side for about 3 minutes.
steps.text: Cook on the second side for about 3 minutes.

steps.flavor_text: Place the pan (if oven safe) under the broiler or transfer the chicken to a sheet tray and place under the broiler. Cook for 2-5 minutes depending on how thick your cheese slices were, how hot your oven is, and how much browning you want on the top. Keep a close eye on the food! Never walk away from food that is under the broiler because it will straight up burn.
steps.text: Place the pan (if oven safe) under the broiler or transfer the chicken to a sheet tray and place under the broiler. Cook for 2-5 minutes depending on how thick your cheese slices were, how hot your oven is, and how much browning you want on the top. Keep a close eye on the food! Never walk away from food that is under the broiler because it will straight up burn.

steps.flavor_text: Remove once it's browned to your liking and optionally garnish with basil or more sauce. Bang! Check out that chicky parm? Took half the time, packs way less calories, and still scratches that itch for something indulgent.
steps.text: Remove once it's browned to your liking and optionally garnish with basil or more sauce. Bang! Check out that chicky parm? Took half the time, packs way less calories, and still scratches that itch for something indulgent.
